Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

mmThundercloud00.name: Thundercloud
mmThundercloud00.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

mmThunderousBell.name: Thunderous Bellow
mmThunderousBell.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=RWBqtTjGSlEgQWCl]], [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=RWBqtTjGSlEgQWCl]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=RWBqtTjGSlEgQWCl]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=RWBqtTjGSlEgQWCl]]. [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=RWBqtTjGSlEgQWCl]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Deafened apply=false] and &Reference[Frightened apply=false] conditions until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

mmTongueTwister0.name: Tongue Twister
mmTongueTwister0.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} in response to that spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. If the target fails its saving throw, it is cursed until the end of its next turn. Until the curse ends, the target can’t cast spells with a Verbal component, and when it speaks, it says the opposite of what it means.

mmTouch000000000.name: Touch
mmTouch000000000.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature or a flammable object that isn’t being worn or carried, it starts burning.

mmToxicEscape000.name: Toxic Escape
mmToxicEscape000.description:
Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is hit by an attack roll.

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] halves the attack’s damage to itself (round down), and it teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=f6zHSW2bzTmUO9oR]] feet of itself.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=f6zHSW2bzTmUO9oR]], each creature within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=f6zHSW2bzTmUO9oR]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s destination space.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, it has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

mmToxicInk000000.name: Toxic Ink
mmToxicInk000000.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Kquf9zADg0jtKBqw]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=Kquf9zADg0jtKBqw]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Kquf9zADg0jtKBqw]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] while it is underwater.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] conditions until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] then moves up to its Speed.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

mmTraining000000.name: Training
mmTraining000000.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM’s choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

mmTrample0000000.name: Trample
mmTrample0000000.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=QckCIpsC3BdEHycI]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=QckCIpsC3BdEHycI]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=QckCIpsC3BdEHycI]] feet that has the Prone condition.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

mmTramplingCharg.name: Trampling Charge
mmTramplingCharg.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its Speed without provoking &Reference[OpportunityAttacks] and can move through the spaces of [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=FG9rAj3Q8UTxbGLF]]. Each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=FG9rAj3Q8UTxbGLF]] whose space the [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters is targeted once by the following effect.

Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=FG9rAj3Q8UTxbGLF]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

mmTransparent000.name: Transparent
mmTransparent000.description: Even when the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is in plain sight, a creature must succeed on a [[/check dc=15 ability=wis skill=prc format=long]] to notice the [[lookup @name lowercase]] if the creature hasn’t witnessed the [[lookup @name lowercase]] move or otherwise act.

mmTrashLob000000.name: Trash Lob
mmTrashLob000000.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

mmTreasureSense0.name: Treasure Sense
mmTreasureSense0.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can pinpoint the location of precious metals and stones within 60 feet of itself.

mmTreeClub000000.name: Tree Club
mmTreeClub000000.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

mmTreeStride0000.name: Tree Stride
mmTreeStride0000.description: If within [[lookup @range.value activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]] feet of a [[lookup @range.special activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports to an unoccupied space within [[lookup @range.value activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]] feet of a second [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]] that is within 60 feet of the previous tree.

mmTrollSpawn0000.name: Troll Spawn
mmTrollSpawn0000.description: The limb uncannily has the same senses as a whole [[lookup @name lowercase]]. If the limb isn’t destroyed within 24 hours, roll [[/r 1d12#On a 12, the limb turns into a troll]]{roll 1d12}. On a 12, the limb turns into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmTroll000000000]{Troll}. Otherwise, the limb withers away.

mmTunneler000000.name: Tunneler
mmTunneler000000.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrow Speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

mmTusk0000000000.name: Tusk (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
mmTusk0000000000.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

mmUmbralDagger00.name: Umbral Dagger
mmUmbralDagger00.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack, the target becomes Stable but has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. While it has the Poisoned condition, the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

mmUmbralStrike00.name: Umbral Strike
mmUmbralStrike00.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item .mmGraveStrike000]] or [[/item .mmSickeningRay00]] attack.

mmUncannyDodge00.name: Uncanny Dodge
mmUncannyDodge00.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=NzfYZzkrG4qJ13to]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] halves the damage (round down) it takes from that attack.

mmUndeadFortitud.name: Undead Fortitude
mmUndeadFortitud.description: If damage reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

mmUndeadRestorat.name: Undead Restoration
mmUndeadRestorat.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it revives 24 hours later in a different body unless @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good} is cast on its corpse. If it revives, it animates a Humanoid corpse elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

mmUnnervingGaze0.name: Unnerving Gaze
mmUnnervingGaze0.description:
Trigger: A [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=btp6NZvx465nxWTF]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see starts its turn within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=btp6NZvx465nxWTF]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Response—Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=btp6NZvx465nxWTF]], the triggering [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=btp6NZvx465nxWTF]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its turn.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Unnerving Gaze for 24 hours.

mmUnsettlingVisa.name: Unsettling Visage
mmUnsettlingVisa.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=USxIbGZPLvfPnnoI]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=USxIbGZPLvfPnnoI]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=USxIbGZPLvfPnnoI]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=USxIbGZPLvfPnnoI]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=USxIbGZPLvfPnnoI]], it succeeds automatically.

mmVampireWeaknes.name: Vampire Weakness
mmVampireWeaknes.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has these weaknesses:

Forbiddance. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.

Running Water. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

Stake to the Heart. If a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s heart while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition in its resting place, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the weapon is removed.

Sunlight. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

mmVampiricConnec.name: Vampiric Connection
mmVampiricConnec.description: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and its vampire master are on the same plane of existence, the vampire can communicate with the [[lookup @name lowercase]] telepathically, and the vampire can perceive through the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s senses.

mmVanish00000000.name: Vanish
mmVanish00000000.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] and its light have the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition until the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s &Reference[Concentration] ends on this effect, which ends early immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack roll or uses Consume Life.

mmVeilOfShadow00.name: Veil of Shadow
mmVeilOfShadow00.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Shadow Stealth, and [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=ODogaJU4TRqxPSNo]] of its choice that it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=ODogaJU4TRqxPSNo]] [[lookup @range.units activity=ODogaJU4TRqxPSNo]]. of it takes [[/damage average]] damage. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

mmVengefulGlare0.name: Vengeful Glare
mmVengefulGlare0.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]], it succeeds automatically. If the Frightened target is cursed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] (see [[/item .LuIttybjU4f7tGCs]]), the target also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration.

mmVileAppearance.name: Vile Appearance
mmVileAppearance.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=FR0ETDHBas1Z5LfF]], any [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=FR0ETDHBas1Z5LfF]] that starts its turn within [[lookup @range.value activity=FR0ETDHBas1Z5LfF]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s true form.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Horrific Appearance for 24 hours.

mmVileSlime00000.name: Vile Slime
mmVileSlime00000.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], or [[/damage average activity=20pphWmNDQZRzF69]] if [[lookup @activation.condition activity=20pphWmNDQZRzF69]]

mmVortex00000000.name: Vortex
mmVortex00000000.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=cZy0VYbCVY8aRB4z]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=cZy0VYbCVY8aRB4z]] in the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=cZy0VYbCVY8aRB4z]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]). Until the grapple ends, the target can’t cast spells with a Verbal component and takes [[/damage average activity=kDz92inkRCjGrPiz]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s turns.

mmWarCry00000000.name: War Cry
mmWarCry00000000.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] or one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=uN0VTW2Fqig7YAs9]] of its choice that can see or hear it gains [[/healing average temp]] and has Advantage on attack rolls until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

mmWardingCharm00.name: Warding Charm
mmWardingCharm00.description:
Trigger: A creature hits the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with an attack roll.

Response—Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=zTaurVqDcUSvviyB]], the triggering creature.

Failure: The attack roll misses the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

mmWarpStep000000.name: Warp Step
mmWarpStep000000.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports, along with [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=xKCUfhoRUHj6f8TE]] of its choice within [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=xKCUfhoRUHj6f8TE]] of it, up to [[lookup @range.value activity=xKCUfhoRUHj6f8TE]] feet [[lookup @range.special activity=xKCUfhoRUHj6f8TE]].

mmWarpingHex0000.name: Warping Hex
mmWarpingHex0000.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=KaTc2c6hOHAqtywC]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=KaTc2c6hOHAqtywC]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=KaTc2c6hOHAqtywC]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level.

Success: Half damage only.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect that will modify the target.  Since the Exhaustion condition can be applied multiple times, the Active Effect must be dragged from this item’s Effects tab onto the target item’s sheet after the initial application of the Exhaustion condition.

mmWaterBound0000.name: Water Bound
mmWaterBound0000.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies if it leaves the water to which it is bound or if that water is destroyed.

mmWaterBreathing.name: Water Breathing
mmWaterBreathing.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe only underwater. It can hold its breath for 1 hour outside water.

mmWaterForm00000.name: Water Form
mmWaterForm00000.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can enter an enemy’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

mmWaterJet000000.name: Water Jet
mmWaterJet000000.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=CY2HqHThU06Jf0Bw]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=CY2HqHThU06Jf0Bw]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=CY2HqHThU06Jf0Bw]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=CY2HqHThU06Jf0Bw]]-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 20 feet straight away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

mmWaterSusceptib.name: Water Susceptibility
mmWaterSusceptib.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 3 (1d6) Cold damage damage for every 5 feet the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves in water or for every gallon of water splashed on it.

Foundry Note

Scaling is configured to roll the correct number of dice based on the distance traveled through water. 1 is default for 5 feet, 2 is for 10 feet, and so forth.

mmWateryRebuke00.name: Watery Rebuke
mmWateryRebuke00.description:
Trigger: An enemy the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=nCfH0YgOhJR2wIKd]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=nCfH0YgOhJR2wIKd]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Response—Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=nCfH0YgOhJR2wIKd]], the triggering enemy.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed up to 30 feet straight away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] by conjured water.

mmWateryRush0000.name: Watery Rush
mmWateryRush0000.description: While underwater, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @activation.condition activity=xoYfePV5epjJkYHX]] without provoking &Reference[Opportunity Attacks].

mmWeakeningBreat.name: Weakening Breath
mmWeakeningBreat.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=EGZ4bS4HpJkfNG9s]], each creature that isn’t currently affected by this breath in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=EGZ4bS4HpJkfNG9s]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests and subtracts 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) from its damage rolls. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=EGZ4bS4HpJkfNG9s]] minute, it succeeds automatically.

mmWeb00000000000.name: Web
mmWeb00000000000.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=6iMoUgxwYlvfKTXr]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=6iMoUgxwYlvfKTXr]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the web is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; Vulnerability to Fire damage; Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage).

mmWebStrand00000.name: Web Strand
mmWebStrand00000.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Ln5NXBaHGKlwdoiP]], one Large or smaller [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=Ln5NXBaHGKlwdoiP]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=Ln5NXBaHGKlwdoiP]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the web is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; Vulnerability to Fire damage; Immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage).

mmWebWalker00000.name: Web Walker
mmWebWalker00000.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webs.

mmWeightOfYears0.name: Weight of Years
mmWeightOfYears0.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=xZul1ImCP658OBv3]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=xZul1ImCP658OBv3]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=xZul1ImCP658OBv3]] feet.

Failure: The target gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level. While the target has any Exhaustion levels, it appears [[/r 3d10]] years older.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

mmWeirdInsight00.name: Weird Insight
mmWeirdInsight00.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=o6eFmn0HWGbQjzdG]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=o6eFmn0HWGbQjzdG]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=o6eFmn0HWGbQjzdG]] feet.

Failure: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically learns one fact or secret about the target.

mmWhelm000000000.name: Whelm
mmWhelm000000000.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=TQchFj2VXXJgU7Lq]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=TQchFj2VXXJgU7Lq]] in the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=TQchFj2VXXJgU7Lq]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]). Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition, is &Reference[suffocating]{suffocating} unless it can breathe water, and takes [[/damage average activity=khxVwH3AB0sx1qRG]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can grapple one Large creature or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at a time with Whelm.

As an action, a creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can pull a creature out of it by succeeding on a [[/check ath dc=@skills.ath.passive format=long]].

Success: Half damage only.

mmWhirlwind00000.name: Whirlwind
mmWhirlwind00000.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=GQzr4EMMm6kkZVdC]], each Medium or smaller [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=GQzr4EMMm6kkZVdC]] in the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is pushed up to 20 feet straight away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

mmWindJavelin000.name: Wind Javelin
mmWindJavelin000.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. or range [[lookup @item.range.value]]/[[lookup @item.range.long]] ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. Hit or Miss: The javelin magically returns to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s hand immediately after a ranged attack.

mmWindStaff00000.name: Wind Staff
mmWindStaff00000.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. or range [[lookup @item.range.value]] ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

mmWishes00000000.name: Wishes
mmWishes00000000.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a [[/r 1d100cs<31#Knows Wish on 1]]{30 percent} chance of knowing the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can understand. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the spell for the creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] suffers none of the spell’s stress. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has cast it three times, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t do so again for 365 days.

mmWitchStrike000.name: Witch Strike
mmWitchStrike000.description: Each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=H15XAJ5lhXfk1d4v]] cursed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and within [[lookup @range.value activity=H15XAJ5lhXfk1d4v]] [[lookup @range.units activity=H15XAJ5lhXfk1d4v]]. of it takes [[/damage average]] damage.

mn8aFoITI9CPUN4B.name: Scimitar
mn8aFoITI9CPUN4B.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target suffers one of the following effects of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice:

Awestruck. The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Poison. The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

musopFV455V6gbo6.name: Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance
musopFV455V6gbo6.description:
You unleash a storm of flashing light and raging thunder in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point you can see within range. While in this area, creatures have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions, and they can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

When the storm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Radiant damage and 2d10 Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Radiant and Thunder damage increase by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

myomZEnYjGO4ePQh.name: Healing Word
myomZEnYjGO4ePQh.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

n05XvhItAfMasHVO.name: Find Familiar
n05XvhItAfMasHVO.description:
You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose: Bat, Cat, Frog, Hawk, Lizard, Octopus, Owl, Rat, Raven, Spider, Weasel, or another Beast that has a Challenge Rating of 0. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form (see appendix B), though it is a Celestial, Fey, or Fiend (your choice) instead of a Beast. Your familiar acts independently of you, but it obeys your commands.

Telepathic Connection. While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as a Bonus Action, you can see through the familiar’s eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses it has.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the touch. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must take a Reaction to deliver the touch when you cast the spell.

Combat. The familiar is an ally to you and your allies. It rolls its own Initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar can’t attack, but it can take other actions as normal.

Disappearance of the Familiar. When the familiar drops to 0 Hit Points, it disappears. It reappears after you cast this spell again. As a Magic action, you can temporarily dismiss the familiar to a pocket dimension. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As a Magic action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. Whenever the familiar drops to 0 Hit Points or disappears into the pocket dimension, it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.

One Familiar Only. You can’t have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new eligible form.
n05XvhItAfMasHVO.materials_component: burning incense worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes

n7uKSkGfYqj4FjU6.name: Tongues
n7uKSkGfYqj4FjU6.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

nCkhRnrrGKCLIAOG.name: Major Image
nCkhRnrrGKCLIAOG.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

nEBoPZejGFPgIfWu.name: Thaumaturgy
nEBoPZejGFPgIfWu.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

nVRTlv14fzhoDhWf.name: Control Weather
nVRTlv14fzhoDhWf.description:
You take control of the weather within 5 miles of you for the duration. You must be outdoors to cast this spell, and it ends early if you go indoors.

When you cast the spell, you change the current weather conditions, which are determined by the DM. You can change precipitation, temperature, and wind. It takes 1d4 × 10 minutes for the new conditions to take effect. Once they do so, you can change the conditions again. When the spell ends, the weather gradually returns to normal.

When you change the weather conditions, find a current condition on the following tables and change its stage by one, up or down. When changing the wind, you can change its direction.

Precipitation
StageCondition
1Clear
2Light clouds
3Overcast or ground fog
4Rain, hail, or snow
5Torrential rain, driving hail, or blizzard
Temperature
StageCondition
1Heat wave
2Hot
3Warm
4Cool
5Cold
6Freezing
Wind
StageCondition
1Calm
2Moderate wind
3Strong wind
4Gale
5Storm

ndzmsLuNebehyo3i.name: Plane Shift
ndzmsLuNebehyo3i.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.
ndzmsLuNebehyo3i.materials_component: a forked, metal rod worth 250+ GP and attuned to a plane of existence

nfMwA64qsTbhzRka.name: Zone of Truth
nfMwA64qsTbhzRka.description:
You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

ngMn9mjUa63VWbHY.name: Dominate Person
ngMn9mjUa63VWbHY.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target has Advantage on the save if you or your allies are fighting it. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

You have a telepathic link with the Charmed target while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. On your turn, you can use this link to issue commands to the target (no action required), such as “Attack that creature,” “Move over there,” or “Fetch that object.” The target does its best to obey on its turn. If it completes an order and doesn’t receive further direction from you, it acts and moves as it likes, focusing on protecting itself.

You can command the target to take a Reaction but must take your own Reaction to do so.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 6 (up to 10 minutes), 7 (up to 1 hour), or 8+ (up to 8 hours).

nszMAjnMbjnShdQz.name: Dread Authority
nszMAjnMbjnShdQz.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Spellcasting to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command}. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

nvZ5JjyGRPRtnuSD.name: Entangle
nvZ5JjyGRPRtnuSD.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

nx98etdOuNlIWdf6.name: Mage Hand
nx98etdOuNlIWdf6.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

nxupE3blwBUB9vqZ.name: Lightning Bolt
nxupE3blwBUB9vqZ.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.
nxupE3blwBUB9vqZ.materials_component: a bit of fur and a crystal rod

o9zHpjCrGZEcIJzZ.name: Dispel Magic
o9zHpjCrGZEcIJzZ.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell’s level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

oKUEoMYZQZaeH1vA.name: Invisibility
oKUEoMYZQZaeH1vA.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

oLMccBEdGE0o3HBt.name: Bless
oLMccBEdGE0o3HBt.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

oMvD1BvnTF1D6Djd.name: Detect Magic
oMvD1BvnTF1D6Djd.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

oVhABdKIr7rLqUKQ.name: Thaumaturgy
oVhABdKIr7rLqUKQ.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

oYladxTqR9cHLNaY.name: Fireball
oYladxTqR9cHLNaY.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.
oYladxTqR9cHLNaY.materials_component: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

oek7louG4zEKd1T7.name: Speak with Dead
oek7louG4zEKd1T7.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn’t return the creature’s soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can’t learn new information, doesn’t comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can’t speculate about future events.

of0sbMf5T95gHk31.name: Shield of Faith
of0sbMf5T95gHk31.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShieldofFa]{Shield of Faith}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

ol8nD34w0qI06026.name: Meld into Stone
ol8nD34w0qI06026.description:
You step into a stone object or surface large enough to fully contain your body, merging yourself and your equipment with the stone for the duration. You must touch the stone to do so. Nothing of your presence remains visible or otherwise detectable by nonmagical senses.

While merged with the stone, you can’t see what occurs outside it, and any [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] checks you make to hear sounds outside it are made with Disadvantage. You remain aware of the passage of time and can cast spells on yourself while merged in the stone. You can use 5 feet of movement to leave the stone where you entered it, which ends the spell. You otherwise can’t move.

Minor physical damage to the stone doesn’t harm you, but its partial destruction or a change in its shape (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals [[/damage 6d6 type=force]] damage to you. The stone’s complete destruction (or transmutation into a different substance) expels you and deals [[/damage 50 type=force]] damage to you. If expelled, you move into an unoccupied space closest to where you first entered and have the &Reference[prone] condition.

om2L5748oLcMi1Rz.name: Antimagic Cone
om2L5748oLcMi1Rz.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s central eye emits an antimagic wave in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=7vRTku30dhIyBf68]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=7vRTku30dhIyBf68]] [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=7vRTku30dhIyBf68]]. Until the start of the beholder’s next turn, that area acts as an @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplAntimagicF] spell, and that area works against the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s own Eye Rays.

onyjgEfAz47OLvDj.name: Psi-Powered Leap
onyjgEfAz47OLvDj.description: The githyanki casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplJump000000]{Jump}, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

ovOl8m4PyxnQNcMs.name: Fireball
ovOl8m4PyxnQNcMs.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.
ovOl8m4PyxnQNcMs.materials_component: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

ovdN9mRTyXP1j08C.name: Detect Evil and Good
ovdN9mRTyXP1j08C.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

ovjYLr2qHJA652lq.name: Shatter
ovjYLr2qHJA652lq.description:
A loud noise erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered there makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d8 Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A Construct has Disadvantage on the save.

A nonmagical object that isn’t being worn or carried also takes the damage if it’s in the spell’s area.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

ow9dnt0OerJUfLau.name: Detect Magic
ow9dnt0OerJUfLau.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

ozFa3jUIZUbtQJw3.name: Mage Hand
ozFa3jUIZUbtQJw3.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

p5Yi2EcPL5VijDFK.name: Detect Thoughts
p5Yi2EcPL5VijDFK.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

pB2kBCFQfO3vNHBI.name: Etherealness
pB2kBCFQfO3vNHBI.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEtherealne]{Etherealness} spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

pCbNvhCgaWNbNwvp.name: Magic Missile
pCbNvhCgaWNbNwvp.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart strikes a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 Force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell creates one more dart for each spell slot level above 1.

[[2 + @item.level]]{Level [[lookup @item.level]] darts}

pF4ucCgUSL6IY7YA.name: Claw
pF4ucCgUSL6IY7YA.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target isn’t an Undead, it has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

pGP49eWCVXNRQplJ.name: Detect Magic
pGP49eWCVXNRQplJ.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

pH1Rf3FfwlD3EELa.name: Fog Cloud
pH1Rf3FfwlD3EELa.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The fog’s radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

pRJU7bqMNKx6FDJS.name: Shapechange
pRJU7bqMNKx6FDJS.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

pTeocF4StpOtAxCp.name: Bless
pTeocF4StpOtAxCp.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

phAFylbfCGfTlXl3.name: Lightning Bolt
phAFylbfCGfTlXl3.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.
phAFylbfCGfTlXl3.materials_component: a bit of fur and a crystal rod

po1oMMVa5As09ueX.name: Shapechange
po1oMMVa5As09ueX.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

pofh5ctUe1WKalYQ.name: Wall of Fire
pofh5ctUe1WKalYQ.description:
You create a wall of fire on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature in its area makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d8 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals 5d8 Fire damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 4.

ppISVKQQqC18ap6D.name: Detect Magic
ppISVKQQqC18ap6D.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

prKe7hfW26vEqzqR.name: Message
prKe7hfW26vEqzqR.description:
You point toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence; 1 foot of stone, metal, or wood; or a thin sheet of lead blocks the spell.

q1mre4L961Eo4H7Z.name: Shield
q1mre4L961Eo4H7Z.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

q6QIeb22Jwvnb6cR.name: Etherealness
q6QIeb22Jwvnb6cR.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can perceive the plane you left, which looks gray, and you can’t see anything there more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. Creatures that aren’t on the Ethereal Plane can’t perceive or interact with you unless a feature gives them the ability to do so.

When the spell ends, you return to the plane you left in the spot that corresponds to your space in the Border Ethereal. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take Force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell ends instantly if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn’t border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target up to three willing creatures (including yourself) for each spell slot level above 7. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

qEsfxo2PL6DyarmX.name: Minor Illusion
qEsfxo2PL6DyarmX.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

qJROiSCEROFUzokI.name: Thaumaturgy
qJROiSCEROFUzokI.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

qLsO05aCvad2nWG6.name: Remove Curse
qLsO05aCvad2nWG6.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner’s Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

qTBTEe8TiMkQRtRA.name: Identify
qTBTEe8TiMkQRtRA.description:
You touch an object throughout the spell’s casting. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires Attunement, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell’s name.

If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn which ongoing spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

qf1A2an7gaBK02zf.name: Detect Magic
qf1A2an7gaBK02zf.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

qi4FBfGudzDz6Lei.name: Commune
qi4FBfGudzDz6Lei.description:
You contact a deity or a divine proxy and ask up to three questions that can be answered with yes or no. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question.

Divine beings aren’t necessarily omniscient, so you might receive “unclear” as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the deity’s knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the deity’s interests, the DM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

r2IgjoKtjunUDKHC.name: Hypnotic Pattern
r2IgjoKtjunUDKHC.description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. While Charmed, the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

r7F4wxmYNSKhoNsz.name: Mage Hand
r7F4wxmYNSKhoNsz.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg.name: Slow
rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot Cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target’s Speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can’t take Reactions. On its turns, it can take either an action or a Bonus Action, not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. If it casts a spell with a Somatic component, there is a [[/r 1d100cs<=25#Slowed spell cast success]]{25 percent} chance the spell fails as a result of the target making the spell’s gestures too slowly.

An affected target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Foundry Note

The inline roll above will return 1 if it succeeded or 0 if it failed.

ri3lPsbel2GU2ONO.name: Control Weather
ri3lPsbel2GU2ONO.description:
You take control of the weather within 5 miles of you for the duration. You must be outdoors to cast this spell, and it ends early if you go indoors.

When you cast the spell, you change the current weather conditions, which are determined by the DM. You can change precipitation, temperature, and wind. It takes 1d4 × 10 minutes for the new conditions to take effect. Once they do so, you can change the conditions again. When the spell ends, the weather gradually returns to normal.

When you change the weather conditions, find a current condition on the following tables and change its stage by one, up or down. When changing the wind, you can change its direction.

Precipitation
StageCondition
1Clear
2Light clouds
3Overcast or ground fog
4Rain, hail, or snow
5Torrential rain, driving hail, or blizzard
Temperature
StageCondition
1Heat wave
2Hot
3Warm
4Cool
5Cold
6Freezing
Wind
StageCondition
1Calm
2Moderate wind
3Strong wind
4Gale
5Storm

rlQTAdOcFfoyN4DR.name: Fly
rlQTAdOcFfoyN4DR.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

rnHaNNaeCidsdNoG.name: Speak with Animals
rnHaNNaeCidsdNoG.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action’s skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don’t pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

rtSVRdwKhJJOuCT5.name: Dancing Lights
rtSVRdwKhJJOuCT5.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell’s range.

rxjB2wfV55BfBp6I.name: Entangle
rxjB2wfV55BfBp6I.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

s2BQFW30FjMjBwyS.name: Calm Emotions
s2BQFW30FjMjBwyS.description:
Each Humanoid in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects (choose for each creature):

  • The creature has Immunity to the Charmed and Frightened conditions until the spell ends. If the creature was already Charmed or Frightened, those conditions are suppressed for the duration.
  • The creature becomes Indifferent about creatures of your choice that it’s Hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target takes damage or witnesses its allies taking damage. When the spell ends, the creature’s attitude returns to normal.

sDcBqPl7Y7t7OD6n.name: Heroes' Feast
sDcBqPl7Y7t7OD6n.description:
You conjure a feast that appears on a surface in an unoccupied 10-foot Cube next to you. The feast takes 1 hour to consume and disappears at the end of that time, and the beneficial effects don’t set in until this hour is over. Up to twelve creatures can partake of the feast.

A creature that partakes gains several benefits, which last for 24 hours. The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.
sDcBqPl7Y7t7OD6n.materials_component: a gem-encrusted bowl worth 1,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

sHGzr73GjWhM74N0.name: Raise Dead
sHGzr73GjWhM74N0.description:
With a touch, you revive a dead creature if it has been dead no longer than 10 days and it wasn’t Undead when it died.

The creature returns to life with 1 Hit Point. This spell also neutralizes any poisons that affected the creature at the time of death.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn’t restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.
sHGzr73GjWhM74N0.materials_component: a diamond worth 500+ GP, which the spell consumes

sMeC6D0sckQCpKZZ.name: Major Image
sMeC6D0sckQCpKZZ.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

sOJ29wIQbeRNa4Qt.name: Shapechange
sOJ29wIQbeRNa4Qt.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

sSktU9MJhyaviFo2.name: Scrying
sSktU9MJhyaviFo2.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn’t know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target’s …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn’t affected, and you can’t use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn’t move.
sSktU9MJhyaviFo2.materials_component: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

t2FrmBjeFeQrFYPL.name: Raise Dead
t2FrmBjeFeQrFYPL.description:
With a touch, you revive a dead creature if it has been dead no longer than 10 days and it wasn’t Undead when it died.

The creature returns to life with 1 Hit Point. This spell also neutralizes any poisons that affected the creature at the time of death.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn’t restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.
t2FrmBjeFeQrFYPL.materials_component: a diamond worth 500+ GP, which the spell consumes

tDpxRgayYQlncN0W.name: Detect Magic
tDpxRgayYQlncN0W.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

tEqmjoNaA80rENZi.name: Component Pouch
tEqmjoNaA80rENZi.description: A Component Pouch is watertight and filled with compartments that hold all the free Material components of your spells.

thdt9qqr4Hh0H8ox.name: Speak with Dead
thdt9qqr4Hh0H8ox.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn’t return the creature’s soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can’t learn new information, doesn’t comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can’t speculate about future events.

tiNmukdjtTyjqq9S.name: Claw
tiNmukdjtTyjqq9S.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=u64Kjp19EAOJoLeo]] [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=u64Kjp19EAOJoLeo]], it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=u64Kjp19EAOJoLeo]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

tl4x0ljxQrhkPLa5.name: Thaumaturgy
tl4x0ljxQrhkPLa5.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

tqXlS6FGdENkOvOt.name: Word of Recall
tqXlS6FGdENkOvOt.description:
You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a location, such as a temple, as a sanctuary by casting this spell there.

ttHR1Q24r6PWC1yB.name: Create Undead
ttHR1Q24r6PWC1yB.description:
You can cast this spell only at night. Choose up to three corpses of Medium or Small Humanoids within range. Each one becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.OBujQLLPSmlJiZnL]{Ghoul} under your control (see the Monster Manual for its stat block).

As a Bonus Action on each of your turns, you can mentally command any creature you animated with this spell if the creature is within 120 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any of them at the same time, issuing the same command to them). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move on its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular place. If you issue no commands, the creature takes the &Reference[Dodge] action and moves only to avoid harm. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow the order until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you’ve given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to three creatures you have animated with this spell rather than animating new ones.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.If you use a level 7 spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over four Ghouls. If you use a level 8 spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over five Ghouls or two @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.IyIybE5t2adMEVUM]{Ghasts} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.rbyp54px2D0ql4QK]{Wights}. If you use a level 9 spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over six Ghouls, three Ghasts or Wights, or two @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.t8WYD7ak07X7xpx8]{Mummies}. See the Monster Manual for these stat blocks.
ttHR1Q24r6PWC1yB.materials_component: one 150+ GP black onyx stone for each corpse

tvVAA7smwcflJu4W.name: Gust of Wind
tvVAA7smwcflJu4W.description:
A Line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the duration. Each creature in the Line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the Line. A creature that ends its turn in the Line must make the same save.

Any creature in the Line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can change the direction in which the Line blasts from you.

tyinbRFXzPtoqy6v.name: Suggestion
tyinbRFXzPtoqy6v.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, “Fetch the key to the cult’s treasure vault, and give the key to me.” Or you could say, “Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don’t return.”

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

tzTPtRBFyMpWOhSU.name: Locate Object
tzTPtRBFyMpWOhSU.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object’s location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can’t locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

uBseLDuXHFh6rSIT.name: Remove Curse
uBseLDuXHFh6rSIT.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner’s Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

uC4rGw0dkXYhJVS8.name: Minor Illusion
